snippet: Even as readers turn to digital versions, some women’s and celebrity-oriented titles had steep circulation losses on the newsstand during the first half of 2013.
abstract: Magazines continue to struggle with sales of subscriptions and newsstand copies, but make inroads in selling digital editions; total paid and verified subscriptions declined by 1 percent in first half of 2013, and newsstand sales, which are often indicator of magazine’s appeal, dropped by 10 percent; both declines were similar to the overall trend in the same period a year ago.
lead_paragraph: Even as readers turn to digital versions, some women’s and celebrity-oriented titles had steep circulation losses on the newsstand during the first half of 2013.

headline.main: Magazine Newsstand Sales Plummet, but Digital Editions Thrive
headline.print_headline: Magazine Newsstand Sales Plummet, but Digital Editions Thrive
